strings.string: This task explains how you get "Pocket Code" on your mobile device.
In this task you’ll get all the stuff you need for your first program in “Pocket Code”.
You need variables to control the x and y position of your parachute.
In this task you name a variable for the x-position of your parachute.
In this task you name a variable and set it as starting y-position of your parachute.
You need to control the position of your parachute all the time. Therefor you need a "Forever" - loop.
You need more bricks inside the "Forever" - loop to control your parachute. You modify the "Place at" - brick so as to control the position of your parachute with the variables "x" an "y".

You need to change the y position of your parachute all the time by -3 with the first "Change variable" - brick. The x position of your parachute is controlled by the inclination of your mobile device.
You should be able to control the height of your parachute with your mobile device's loudness sensor. Therefor you need to add and modify a "If 1 is true then" - brick.
You need to add and change a "When I receive" - brick if you want restart the game with the parachute's initial positions.
Now you are done with your first object. The parachute should work fine now, but to play the game we need to modify some more objects. Up next you need to navigate back to the object overview.
In this task the object „target“ gets modified. To control your target you need to add the following bricks.
If the game is restarted, the target should change the position. Therefor you need to set the x- and y-position by random values.
Up next you need to modify the "Place at" - brick in in order, that you can control the position of your target with the variables "goalx" an "goaly".
The parcel should only be shown when the parcel receives the message "start". Therefor you need to edit the object "parcel".
To check if the parcel hits the target, you need a "If 1 is true then"- brick.
You should win if a parcel hits the target. In this case you have to fix the position of the parcel and to tell the other objects of your triumph.
Now you have to modify the object “restart”. You need to define the position and the behaviour of the object.
In this last task, you’ll finish the program by modifying the "background" object and finally you can start playing the game.
Tap "Explore" in "Pocket Code" on your Mobile Device.
Pull down the menu and tap "Open Skydiving Steve".
Drag and drop the "Set variable" - brick below the "When program started" - brick.
Add a second variable just as before.
Drag and drop the "Forever" - brick below the "Set variable" - bricks.
Insert the shown bricks below the "Forever" - brick.
Tap "200" in the same brick on the top, go to the "Variables" category and choose "y". Confirm with "OK".
Change the value of the first "Set variable" - brick to "-3".
At the second "Set variable" - brick tap the field "0.0".
Check if your inserted formula matches the one in the screenshot and confirm with "OK".
Add a “If 1 is true then” - brick and place it below the last “Change variable” - brick.
Tap the field with the value "0" within the "If 1 is true then" - brick.
Check if your formula matches the formula in the screenshot and tap "OK".
Add a "Change variable" - brick and modify the value like above.
Place it below the last brick ("End of loop").
Tap the field filled with "message 1", choose "New…" and insert "restart".
Change the values of the two "Set variable" - bricks like shown in the screenshot above.
Tap the "back" - button on your device.
Now you should see this screen on your device.
Add and modify the bricks as in the screenshot above.
Add four more bricks like shown above.
Tap the field "0.0" and insert the formula "random(-400, 400)".
Repeat the steps 1-3 for the second "Set variable" - brick, expect naming the variable "goaly" and setting the value to "random(400, -700)".
Add a "Place at" - brick and set the field "100" to variable "goalx" and the field "200" to variable "goaly".
Check if your values match the ones above.
Go back until you see this screen.
Add all the bricks shown above.
Change the value of the "Set size" - brick to "50".
Tap the field "restart" within the "When I receive" - brick and create the new message: "start".
Change the values of the "Place at" - brick to "x" and "y".
Add the above shown bricks below the last "Place at" - brick.
Change the value within the "Change Y by" - brick to "-5". Then tap into the field "1" within the "If 1 is true then".
Insert the shown formula and tap "OK".
"position_x" and "position_y" can be found in the category "Object".
Change the values of the "Place at" - brick to "position_x" and "goaly+100".
Tap the field "Broadcast" and create a new message "win".
Add the above shown bricks and modify their values alike.
Go back until you see this screen on your device. Go to the scripts of the object "restart".
Add the above shown bricks and modify their values alike.
Add the above shown bricks and set the "Broadcast" - message to "restart".
Go back until you see this screen, then go to the scripts of “Background”.
Add the above shown bricks and set the "Broadcast" - message to "start".
You've successfully completed the tutorial "Skydiving Steve". We would be pleased to find some really cool modifications of "Skydiving Steve" on pocketcode.org
